resources.string: See the world through your loved one\'s eyes
Press the info icon in the top right of the screen for a full user guide.

Press the button below to create a User Profile.
 You will be shown a series of C shapes drawn in different shades of red, green or blue dots on a background comprised of grey dots.
 You are asked to find the gap in the C and touch the section of the screen divided by the white lines at the edges of the screen where you think the gap is located.
 You DO NOT need to press the actual location of the gap and are encouraged not to as the application may misinterpret, instead please press the centre of the quadrant or close to the edge of the screen.
 If the image is too difficult for you then please press the central box to skip to the next image.
 In the top right hand side of the screen is a pencil icon that will allow you to run a CVD simulation over the top of this test using either one of the three standard simulations or a personal simulation created from a pre-existing profile.
 Be Warned pressing one of the personal profile buttons will cause the program to seemingly freeze for around 10 seconds, this is normal and the program is busy generating simulation data for your chosen profile.

Press the cog button found in the upper right of the screen after starting the application and have your colour blind person complete the small two minute test in order to build a profile for their specific CVD, and then name it, hit the enter key to close the keyboard and press the save profile button which will save your profile and return you to the main menu.

 If you have at least one profile saved then a key button will be present in the top right of the screen, press this to show a list of saved profiles, click on one to delete the profile.

 The cross icon in the top right of the screen will close the current application and return to the main menu or if at the main menu to close the application.

 After pressing the Start Simulation button from the main menu you will begin the application with an initially clear camera view.
 You must press the pencil icon in the top right of the screen to show a dropdown menu with a series of various vision modes that you may select.
 Be Warned pressing one of the perosnal profile buttons will cause the program to seemingly freeze for around 10 seconds, this is normal and the program is busy generating simulation data for your chosen profile.

 The camera icon in the top right of the screen is to take a photo of the current screen and save it to your SD card.
Press enter when done to close the keyboard
